Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the length of time the nation has gone without a secretary of the Treasury, stating it is the longest or "darn close to it", when in fact there have been longer periods with an acting secretary.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that there has been an acting Treasury secretary in place since Jan. 20, 2017, overseeing the agency's business.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that it is the longest period the nation has gone without a secretary of the Treasury.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the delay in confirming the nominee is solely the fault of Senate Democrats, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the delay.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the delay in confirming the nominee may be due to concerns about misleading statements made during the nomination hearing.
